alert.note: Alert for Autauga; Lowndes (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 2:03PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Autauga and northern Lowndes Counties through 245 PM CDT... At 203 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Vida Junction, or 13 miles east of Valley Grande, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mosses, Autaugaville, White Hall, Billingsley, Lowndesboro, Booth, Mulberry, Vida Junction, Manack, Robert F. Henry Lock And Dam and Dawson Mill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
